üèù Deep Learning Workshop

  • Python
  • ~ TensorFlow
  • ~ Jupyter Notebooks
  • ~ Google Colaboratory

Venture into AI and deep learning with this three-day workshop. You will be taken from the mathematical and theoretical foundations, to building models and neural networks in TensorFlow.

You will apply as you learn, working on exercises throughout in a supportive and collaborative environment.

The second day will be dedicated to gaining a hands-on understanding of TensorFlow.

The third day will be centered around group projects.

Concepts covered
  • Programming vs. Machine Learning vs. Deep Learning
  • Notation of Neural Networks
  • Autoencoders, Visual Search
  • Representation Learning, Embeddings
  • Convolutions, Pooling
  • Neurons, Weights, Activation Functions
  • Layers, Loss Functions, Optimisation
  • Optimisation, Gradient Descent, Regularisation
  • TensorFlow, Building and Training Models
  • Data Loading, TensorBoard, Model Evaluation
Essential details
Duration 3 days
9am-5pm sharp, every day.
Costs $2,625* (Standard)
$2,100* Earlybird - Until Jan 31st, 2019!

Dates/Tickets

Requirements A laptop.

*Note: People that identify as women receive a 15% discount (use the code "FEMINISM"), and people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent can attend for free (use the code "ATSI"). These discounts are provided as part of our commitment to diversity, empowerment and rebalancing.

Breakdown of the days

Day 1 - Fundamentals: Deep Learning, Learning Theory, Convolutions, Embeddings.

The first day provides a solid base of knowledge, by covering key concepts through group learning and exercises.

Attendees will implement a reference model in TensorFlow, and learn the necessary components of all deep learning training pipelines.

Day 2 - Hands-On TensorFlow: TensorBoard, Training, Evaluation.

On the second day we will work through the details of training models in TensorFlow in more detail. We will build a reference model, and learn how to train our model, check it's progress, and evaluate it's accuracy.

Day 3 - Group Projects.

The last day provides hands-on experience in deep learning model development, in TensorFlow.

Participants will consolidate their knowledge by working in small groups on independent projects. Project options vary across image processing, embeddings, and generative models.
